clinical_study.brief_title: Prevalence and Characterization of Persistent Dyspnea After Hospitalization
clinical_study.official_title: Prevalence and Characterization of Persistent Dyspnea After an Hospitalization for a Respiratory Disease

lead_sponsor.agency: Association pour le Développement et l'Organisation de la Recherche en Pneumologie et sur le Sommeil

clinical_study.source: Association pour le Développement et l'Organisation de la Recherche en Pneumologie et sur le Sommeil

brief_summary.textblock: The investigators aim to make an overview of persistent dyspnea at the end of an hospitalization for a respiratory disease using an actual tool, the Multidisciplinary Dyspnea Profile questionnaire.

primary_outcome.measure: Prevalence of persistent dyspnea in the end of an hospitalization for a a respiratory disease
primary_outcome.time_frame: An average of one week, until the end of the hospitalization

secondary_outcome.measure: Characterization of persistent dyspnea using MDP
secondary_outcome.time_frame: An average of one week, until the end of the hospitalization

secondary_outcome.measure: Outcome of patients with persistent dyspnea after hospitalization

intervention.description: Multidisciplinary Dyspnea Profile questionnaire at the beginning and the end of an hospitalization

study_pop.textblock: Every consecutive patient admitted to hospitalization for a respiratory cause having a significant dyspnea

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Age over 18 years old
- Able to respond the questionnaire
- Presenting at admission a dyspnea over 3/10 on numerical analogic scale
- Admitted for a respiratory cause
Exclusion Criteria:
- cognitive impairment
- aphasia
- no french-speaking person
